meta.source_provenance: Email from noreply-public@digital-policing.co.uk to Ben Carter on 2024-11-13 (issued on behalf of PC Jonathan Dixon, Sussex Police)

emails.subject_summary: Jonathan Dixon requires your assistance in a police investigation
emails.body_raw:
You have been requested by Jonathan Dixon, a Police Officer or member of Police Staff, to provide data to assist with a police investigation/enquiry.
Please click here to respond to this request. The link will expire on 27/11/2024.
emails.body: Evidence-portal request sent to Ben Carter via Digital Policing, issued on behalf of PC Jonathan Dixon, Sussex Police (second message within one minute).

sentence_tags.text: The link to the request will expire on 27/11/2024.
sentence_tags.notes: Duplicate-seeming request sent one minute later with identical expiry; risk of confusion or redundancy.

contradiction_links.claim: Police provided a single, clear access point for evidence submission.
contradiction_links.reality: Two nearly identical Digital Policing requests were issued one minute apart on 13/11/2024, both with the same expiry date (27/11/2024).

events: Second Digital Policing portal request issued on behalf of PC Jonathan Dixon (case 47240214305) within one minute of the prior email.

damages_summary.emotional: Stress/confusion due to duplicate requests in quick succession.
damages_summary.strategic: Raises doubt whether portal coordination was functioning properly.
damages_summary.reputational: Could be mischaracterised as victim ignoring multiple requests.
